title: [$250] Upgrade the delete workspace flow to a non-blocking UI pattern

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
## Problem We updated the error pattern for when we delete workspaces in this recent PR: https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/64015. However we made it into a blocking pattern because it was difficult to figure out how to make it a non-blocking pattern for offline flows. Making the workspace deletion flow a blocking pattern makes the app less usable for users with bad internet connections, hindering our ability to attract a large user base and compete. ## Solution Make the pattern a non-blocking pattern. ### Behavior Pre-requisites: - User owns a workspace with three purchases and an annual subscription that has not expired. 1. Go to the workspaces page 2. Click on the kebab menu 3. Click `Delete` OR 1. Go to the workspace settings > Overview 2. Click `Delete` ## Expected Result: **Online** 1. User clicks `Delete` 2. A centered alert modal appears: ``` Delete workspace You can’t delete the workspace until the end of the annual subscription term. [Got it] ``` ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/442996f2-0201-43e5-82e3-16f0b6588c78) ___ **Offline** 1. User clicks `Delete` 2. The workspace is optimistically deleted (i.e appears at 50% opacity & strikethrough on the Workspaces page) 3. User comes back online 4. The RBR dismissible message is added in-line that reads: "You can’t delete the workspace until the end of the annual subscription term." 5. User dismisses the error message and it disappears ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ebd01d4e-1ccb-46c8-ac62-e7da191ddfad) ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/06468b57-10f0-4407-8f99-f11e827fe0c5) cc: @trjExpensify

  • Upwork Job ID: 1981759486700878032

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.2.37-6 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1439/folder/13176791/41237172/969659997 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** Slottwo1 fgg55@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Redminote 10s android 13 phone **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/home 2. Open workspace chat 3. Create a manual expense for (-8) 4. Open the expense details of transaction 5. Tap more - split expense 6. Remove the second split 7. Add a split 8. Change amount to 0.01 9. Remove negative sign from first split by keeping cursor on first split 10.Note the text above save button mentioning total is less than original amount 11. Tap save ## Expected Result: Step 10 : The text above the save button is incorrect. It should say 'Total amount is 4.01 greater than the original expense,' and the user should not be able to split the expense. ## Actual Result: Step 10 : The text above the save button is displayed as 'Total amount is 3.99 less than the original expense' . Even though the correct total amount is 4.01, which is actually greater than the original expense. Error displayed after click save button in Step 11 : - The sum of split amounts exceeds the original amount - Unexpected error submitting this expense. Please try again later. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a4f5a6d1-1ab0-404a-80c4-a17b8ec751ee [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [CMB] [$250] Block submission and approval in New Expensify if DEW is enabled on the workspace

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

body:
[Slack Thread 🧵](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1761237774731669?thread_ts=1761159769.356729&cid=C07NMDKEFMH) ## Problem DEW isn't fully supported in NewDot, meaning that if a user manually submits or approve from NewDot in a workspace with DEW enabled, the report is routed incorrectly. ## Solution If a user tries manually submitting or approving a report from NewDot on a workspace with approvalMode = `DYNAMIC_EXTERNAL`, block that action and show a warning modal directing the user back to Expensify Classic. We store `approvalMode` in the policy object. Here's what the modal would look like: The modal text should read: **Title** = Custom approval workflow **Body** = Your company has a custom approval workflow on this workspace, please take this action in Expensify Classic **Button text** = Switch to Expensify Classic

Navigate to Profile> Private> Phone number 2. Enter a phone number without the + prefix or with formatting characters (e.g., (201) 867-5309). 3. Confirm the error message is displayed for invalid input. ” ## Expected Result: The error message should read: “Please enter a complete phone number (e.g., +1-(201)-867-5309). ## Actual Result: The error message read: "Please enter a valid phone number, with the country code (e.g. +15005550006)" ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4d8f4cb6-4a6e-484f-b679-fd3676e90a14 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Workspace - Review your workspace settings link leads to Hmm... it's not here page

labels.name: External

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.37-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1440/folder/13177080/41237953/969661304?sort=-identifier **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: Precondition: The user is an admin of the workspace 1. Navigate to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Navigate to members and invite an account that doesn't have an expensifail account 3. Select the new member and set them as admin 4. Log in as the new set Admin 5. Navigate to "Concierge" chat in LHN 6. Verify task displayed as "Review your workspace settings" with checkbox 6. Click the "Workspace settings" hyperlink ## Expected Result: Clicking the "Workspace settings" hyperlink, it redirects to workspace settings ## Actual Result: Review your workspace settings link leads to Hmm... it's not here page. In Production, the Workspace settings hyperlink redirects to staging ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
